name: Mexican Oxtail Beef Soup
author: Diana Flores Akins
summary: This is a easy, fool-proof recipe, handed down by my mom who was a wonderful cook.  I try my best to recreate her awesome dishes.
ingredients: 2 pounds beef oxtail, cut into pieces
4 ears corn on the cob, broken in half
2  russet potatoes, cut into bite-sized pieces
⅓ cup lentils, picked over and rinsed
1 head cabbage, cored and cut into 8 wedges
directions: Heat the olive oil in a large soup pot over medium heat, and brown the oxtails and beef stew meat on all sides
Add water to cover the meat, bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook for 30 minutes
Skim off and discard any foam that collects at the top
Drop in the bouillon cube, onion, celery, chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, and corn ears, stir to combine, and simmer the soup until the meat is very tender, about 2 hours
Stir in the carrots and potatoes, simmer for 30 more minutes, then stir in the lentils, rice, mixed vegetables, and cabbage
Simmer until the rice, lentils, and cabbage are tender, about 30 more minutes
Serve with a half ear of corn in each bowl, with hot steamed tortillas for dipping in the broth
